name: Hatch Chile Verde
author: Yoly
summary: Hubby and I are Hatch chile fanatics. We buy 50 pounds of roasted Hatch chiles when they are in season. We portion them out and freeze them so they are readily available. This chile verde does not call for tomatillos because I wanted the chiles to be the star of the recipe.
ingredients: 8  Hatch chile peppers, or more as needed
2 pounds pork butt, cut into 1-inch chunks
4 cups chicken broth, or more as needed
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Place Hatch chiles directly on the grates of a gas stove
Cook over medium heat, flipping with tongs occasionally, until blackened and charred, about 5 minutes
Place in a sealed plastic bag and allow to cool, 7 to 8 minutes
Peel off charred skins, remove seeds, and cut 1/2 of the chiles into 1-inch squares
Place remaining chiles in a food processor and process until finely chopped
Add processed chiles to chopped chiles
Combine pork cubes, water, and salt in a Dutch oven
Cover and cook over medium heat for 20 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes
Uncover, raise heat to medium-high, and cook, stirring constantly until the water evaporates and the pork browns in its rendered fat, 15 to 20 minutes
Heat oil in the Dutch oven
Add onion; cook and stir until soft and translucent, 5 to 7 minutes
Add garlic and cumin and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute
Stir in flour and cook for 1 to 2 minutes
Add chiles, pork, chicken broth, canned tomatoes, salt, and pepper
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until pork cubes are fork-tender, about 1 1/2 hours
